description: From the past participle of Latin continuare.

adjectives.description: continuate (comparative more continuate, superlative most continuate)

entries.meaning: (obsolete) Continuous; uninterrupted; continued without break or interruption.
examples: Childish in some, terrible in others; to be derided in one, pitied or admired in another; to him by fits, to a second continuate: and howsoever these symptoms be common and incident to all persons, yet they are the most remarkable, frequent, furious, and violent in melancholy men.
